metadata.description: Benchmark dataset for AI triage engine accuracy testing

findings.title: SQL Injection via string concatenation
findings.description: SQL query constructed using string concatenation with user input
findings.code_snippet: query = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = '" + username + "'"

ground_truth.reasoning: Direct string concatenation in SQL query without sanitization

findings.title: SQL Injection via f-string
findings.description: SQL query constructed using f-string with user input
findings.code_snippet: query = f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = {user_id}"

ground_truth.reasoning: F-string interpolation in SQL query allows injection

findings.title: SQL Injection via .format()
findings.description: SQL query constructed using .format() with user input

ground_truth.reasoning: .format() method allows SQL injection through user input

findings.title: SQL Injection via % formatting
findings.description: SQL query constructed using % formatting with user input
findings.code_snippet: query = "SELECT * FROM products WHERE category = '%s'" % category

ground_truth.reasoning: % formatting in SQL query enables injection attacks

findings.title: False positive - parameterized query with placeholders

ground_truth.reasoning: Uses parameterized query with ? placeholder - safe from injection

findings.title: False positive - prepared statement
findings.code_snippet:
stmt = db.prepare("SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = $1")
result = stmt.execute([user_id])

ground_truth.reasoning: Prepared statement with parameterization - protected from injection
ORM automatically parameterizes queries - safe from injection

findings.title: SQL Injection in ORDER BY clause
findings.description: Dynamic ORDER BY clause constructed with user input
findings.code_snippet: query = f"SELECT * FROM products ORDER BY {sort_column}"

ground_truth.reasoning: ORDER BY clause vulnerable to injection attacks

findings.title: SQL Injection in LIMIT clause
findings.description: Dynamic LIMIT clause with user input

ground_truth.reasoning: LIMIT clause allows injection if not validated

findings.title: Needs investigation - execute with params
findings.description: Uses execute() but unclear if parameterized

ground_truth.reasoning: Cannot determine if build_query() returns safe parameterized query

findings.title: SQL Injection in dynamic table name
findings.description: Table name dynamically constructed from user input

ground_truth.reasoning: Dynamic table names cannot be parameterized - requires whitelist validation

findings.title: False positive - named parameters
findings.code_snippet: cursor.execute("SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = :email", {'email': email})

ground_truth.reasoning: Named parameters (:param) provide protection from injection

findings.title: SQL Injection via multiple concatenations
findings.description: Multiple string concatenations in complex query

ground_truth.reasoning: Multiple concatenations build unsafe query

findings.title: SQL Injection in INSERT statement
findings.code_snippet: query = f"INSERT INTO users (name, email) VALUES ('{name}', '{email}')"

ground_truth.reasoning: INSERT with f-string allows SQL injection

findings.title: SQL Injection in UPDATE statement
findings.code_snippet: query = "UPDATE users SET status = '" + status + "' WHERE id = " + str(user_id)

ground_truth.reasoning: UPDATE with string concatenation vulnerable to injection

findings.title: SQL Injection in DELETE statement
findings.code_snippet: query = f"DELETE FROM logs WHERE date < '{cutoff_date}'"

ground_truth.reasoning: DELETE with f-string allows dangerous injection

findings.title: False positive - multiple placeholders
findings.code_snippet: cursor.execute("SELECT * FROM orders WHERE user_id = ? AND status = ?", (user_id, status))

ground_truth.reasoning: Multiple placeholders with tuple params - safe

findings.title: Needs investigation - string with question mark
findings.code_snippet: query = "SELECT * FROM comments WHERE text LIKE '%?%'"

ground_truth.reasoning: ? is in string literal not parameter - needs context to determine safety

findings.title: SQL Injection via JOIN clause
findings.description: Dynamic JOIN clause with user input
findings.code_snippet: query = f"SELECT * FROM users u JOIN {join_table} j ON u.id = j.user_id"

ground_truth.reasoning: Dynamic JOIN table name vulnerable to injection

findings.title: SQL Injection in WHERE IN clause
findings.description: WHERE IN clause with string concatenation
findings.code_snippet: query = f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id IN ({','.join(map(str, ids))})"

ground_truth.reasoning: IN clause with concatenated IDs allows injection

findings.title: False positive - PostgreSQL numbered placeholders
findings.code_snippet: cursor.execute("SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = $1 AND active = $2", [email, True])

ground_truth.reasoning: PostgreSQL numbered placeholders are safe

findings.title: SQL Injection in stored procedure call
findings.description: Stored procedure called with concatenated parameters

ground_truth.reasoning: Stored procedure with concatenated string parameter
Query builder safety depends on library implementation

findings.title: XSS via innerHTML with user input
findings.description: User input directly inserted into innerHTML

ground_truth.reasoning: innerHTML with unsanitized user input enables XSS

findings.title: XSS via template string in HTML
findings.description: Template literal used to construct HTML with user data

ground_truth.reasoning: Template literal in innerHTML without escaping
document.write with concatenated user input

findings.title: XSS via eval() with user input

ground_truth.reasoning: eval() with user input is extremely dangerous
textContent automatically escapes HTML - safe from XSS
escapeHtml() function sanitizes user input

findings.title: False positive - createElement with textContent

ground_truth.reasoning: createElement + textContent is safe - no HTML parsing
dangerouslySetInnerHTML with user content enables XSS
javascript: href allows arbitrary code execution
Event handler attribute with user input enables XSS

findings.title: Needs investigation - React component with user prop

ground_truth.reasoning: React escapes by default but need to verify bio source
Unvalidated redirect URL can use javascript: protocol
jQuery html() is equivalent to innerHTML - vulnerable
jQuery text() escapes HTML - safe from XSS
trustAsHtml bypasses Angular's sanitizer
v-html renders raw HTML without escaping
Vue escapes interpolated content by default
srcdoc renders HTML in iframe context - XSS risk
createContextualFragment parses and executes HTML
DOMParser can execute scripts if content inserted into document
DOMPurify removes XSS vectors before insertion
Need to verify if template engine escapes by default

findings.title: XSS via postMessage without origin check

ground_truth.reasoning: postMessage data rendered as HTML without origin check

findings.title: Path Traversal via direct concatenation
findings.description: File path constructed by concatenating user input

ground_truth.reasoning: Direct path concatenation allows ../ traversal
os.path.join vulnerable to absolute path override
F-string path construction allows ../ traversal

findings.title: False positive - Path validation with realpath
findings.code_snippet:
base = os.path.realpath('/uploads')
path = os.path.realpath(os.path.join(base, filename))
if not path.startswith(base):
    raise ValueError('Invalid path')

ground_truth.reasoning: realpath + startswith check prevents traversal

findings.title: False positive - Whitelist validation

ground_truth.reasoning: Whitelist validation prevents arbitrary file access

findings.title: Path Traversal in open() call
findings.code_snippet:
with open(user_path, 'r') as f:
    content = f.read()

ground_truth.reasoning: Direct open() with user path allows reading any file
Path division operator vulnerable to traversal
User-controlled destination allows overwriting files
replace('..', '') can be bypassed with .../ - partial sanitization
Zip slip vulnerability - malicious archives can write anywhere

findings.title: False positive - Safe archive extraction

ground_truth.reasoning: Validates member paths before extraction
send_file with user filename allows arbitrary file download
send_from_directory validates path stays in directory
User-controlled path in os.remove allows deleting any file
Following symlinks can escape directory boundaries
basename removes directory components preventing traversal

findings.title: Path Traversal in template path
findings.description: Template file loaded from user input

ground_truth.reasoning: User-controlled template path can load arbitrary files

findings.title: Needs investigation - Path with regex validation

ground_truth.reasoning: Regex looks safe but need to verify it's applied before file access

findings.title: Path Traversal via URL parameter
findings.code_snippet:
file_path = request.args.get('file')
with open(file_path) as f:

ground_truth.reasoning: Direct URL parameter to file path allows arbitrary file access

findings.title: Path Traversal in config file loading
findings.description: Config file path from user input

ground_truth.reasoning: User config name allows reading arbitrary JSON files

findings.title: False positive - UUID-based filenames
findings.code_snippet:
import uuid
file_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
path = f'/uploads/{file_id}'

ground_truth.reasoning: UUID-generated paths not user-controlled
secure_filename() sanitizes the path

findings.title: Needs investigation - Custom path sanitization

ground_truth.reasoning: Custom sanitization may miss edge cases like ..\
Hardcoded AWS access key in source code
Database password hardcoded in connection string
Stripe API key hardcoded
JWT secret key hardcoded - compromises all tokens
Reads from environment variable - not hardcoded

findings.title: False positive - Config file reference
findings.code_snippet:
with open('config.json') as f:
    config = json.load(f)
    api_key = config['api_key']

ground_truth.reasoning: Loads from external config - not hardcoded in source

findings.title: Hardcoded SSH private key
findings.description: SSH private key embedded in code
findings.code_snippet:
PRIVATE_KEY = '''-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
MIIEpAIBAAKCAQEA...
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----'''

ground_truth.reasoning: SSH private key hardcoded in source
Encryption key hardcoded - compromises all encrypted data
OAuth client secret hardcoded
Default admin credentials hardcoded
Comment showing example - not actual secret

findings.title: Hardcoded GitHub token
findings.description: GitHub personal access token in code

ground_truth.reasoning: GitHub personal access token hardcoded
Slack webhook URL hardcoded - allows posting to channel

findings.title: False positive - Public key
findings.code_snippet:
PUBLIC_KEY = '''-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----
MIIBIjANBgkq...
-----END PUBLIC KEY-----'''

ground_truth.reasoning: Public key is meant to be shared - not a secret
SMTP password hardcoded
Flask secret key hardcoded - compromises sessions
Retrieves from secrets manager - not hardcoded
Redis password hardcoded in connection

findings.title: Needs investigation - Constant that might be secret

ground_truth.reasoning: Could be test token or actual secret - need context

findings.title: Hardcoded Twilio credentials
findings.description: Twilio account SID and auth token

ground_truth.reasoning: Twilio credentials hardcoded

findings.title: False positive - Hash of password (not password itself)

ground_truth.reasoning: Password hash not the actual password - acceptable to store
Firebase API key hardcoded
Base64 might encode credentials - needs decoding to verify
MD5 is cryptographically broken - vulnerable to collisions
SHA1 is deprecated for password hashing - no salt
DES has 56-bit keys - easily brute forced
ECB mode doesn't use IV - patterns leak in ciphertext
bcrypt is secure password hashing algorithm
SHA256 appropriate for file integrity checks
RC4 has known biases - deprecated
1024-bit RSA keys can be factored - use 2048+ bits
4096-bit RSA is cryptographically strong
NULL cipher provides no encryption
random module not cryptographically secure - use secrets

findings.title: False positive - secrets module for tokens

ground_truth.reasoning: secrets module is cryptographically secure
Blowfish 64-bit block size vulnerable to birthday attacks
AES-GCM is modern authenticated encryption
SHA256 without salt vulnerable to rainbow tables

findings.title: Static IV in encryption
findings.code_snippet:
IV = b'0000000000000000'
cipher = AES.new(key, AES.MODE_CBC, IV)

ground_truth.reasoning: Static IV defeats purpose of CBC mode

findings.title: False positive - Random IV generation
findings.code_snippet:
iv = os.urandom(16)
cipher = AES.new(key, AES.MODE_CBC, iv)

ground_truth.reasoning: Random IV properly generated

findings.title: Custom crypto implementation

ground_truth.reasoning: Custom crypto almost always weak - use standard libraries

findings.title: Needs investigation - Third-party crypto library
findings.code_snippet:
from obscure_crypto import encrypt
encrypted = encrypt(data, key)

ground_truth.reasoning: Unknown library - need to verify it uses standard algorithms
TLS 1.0 has known vulnerabilities - use TLS 1.2+
PROTOCOL_TLS_SERVER uses latest secure TLS version
Disabling SSL verification enables MITM attacks

findings.title: Needs investigation - Argon2 with custom params

ground_truth.reasoning: Argon2 is strong but params look weak - need expert review
